page.title: 02Shouldham-A typical weekend
page.content: {JUNE 1985} Most children got up by 9.30am and watched television. Others read and played and some went shopping to Downham or King's Lynn. Much of the Saturday was spent in these activities whilst the parents were doing jobs like washing, decorating or gardening. A few went to visit relatives; the furthest journey being made by road was to Hatfield. Sport or physical activity played a small part - some went for a cycle ride, swimming or horse riding. The evening was spent watching television or reading and most children were in bed by 9pm. although some did not go until 11pm. The Sunday followed much the same pattern but there was more emphasis on family activity such as walks or a ride out in the car.Bedtime was on average earlier.
